author: News On February
title: Bahamas famous swimming pigs found dead in mysterious circumstances - Yahoo7
text:
Share Bahamas famous swimming pigs found dead in mysterious circumstances - Yahoo7 More than one third of The Bahamas‚Äô famous swimming pigs have been found dead under mysterious circumstances. Bahamas' famous pigs found dead amid fears overbearing tourists are endangering them UP NEXT VIDEO Bahamas' famous pigs found dead amid fears overbearing tourists are endangering them. Source: Snapchat Bahamas' famous pigs found dead amid fears overbearing tourists are endangering them 
Investigators are probing the deaths of seven hogs near ‚ÄòPig Beach‚Äô, a tropical paradise frequented by bikini-clad celebrities. 
‚ÄúIt could just be a horrible accident where they ate something poisonous,' Bahamas Humane Society President President Kim Aranha told reporters. 
‚ÄúIt could be malicious, but I don‚Äôt really see why someone would go out of their way to hurt those lovely animals.‚Äù Bahamas' swimming pigs have made the Exuma Cay beach a tourist hotspot. Source: Instagram Model Bella Thorne, like many before her, posed holding the cute swimming pigs for that much needed Instagram shot. Source: Instagram 
'It‚Äôs really a mystery as to what killed these beautiful animals.‚Äù 
The iconic pigs have become a tourist draw card for many years, featuring on episodes of ‚ÄòThe Bachelor‚Äô, while Donald Trump Jr, Amy Schumer and Bella Thorne also paid visits to the Exuma Cay beach in recent months. 
However the same popularity that made the swimming pigs famous may now be leading their colony to extinction. With heavy hearts we await results of investigations. Again we URGE all visitors to be mindful of their actions! https://t.co/iIprbntuXs ‚Äî When Pigs Swim‚Ñ¢ (@WhenPigsSwim1) February 22, 2017 The swimming pigs made headlines when they appeared on the United States version of The Bachelor. Source: abc US Donald Trump Junior and his family also took time out to snap some images with the pigs. Source: Instagram 
‚ÄúWe have people coming there giving the pigs beer, rum, riding on top of them, all kinds of stuff," Bahamas local and pig owner Wayde Nixon told the Nassau Guardian. 
"I know there are a lot of silly sailors that go and feed them alcohol to try and get them drunk, but that‚Äôs not to mistake them with the tour operators based out of Nassau who have treated them with excellent care," Ms Aranha added. 
The dead pigs were buried in the same ocean they so adored. @WhenPigsSwim1 @TheExumaDream not a selfie but I got this üëç pic.twitter.com/cpGW7wfB6N ‚Äî JAKOB OWENS (@JakobOwens) February 16, 2017 This experience was soooo wild haha üáßüá∏ #Exuma pic.twitter.com/zN7ek4OofT ‚Äî JAKOB OWENS (@JakobOwens) February 16, 2017 Pigs can't fly but they sure can swim!
